question.body: Sometimes medication or radiation can reduce the amount of saliva a person produces, resulting in a condition called dry mouth. What effect would this have on their sense of taste?

part.explanation: They will probably have a reduction in ability to taste or things will taste different and maybe they could temporarily lose the sense of taste completely. Without saliva, only liquid would likely be tasted because the saliva is necessary to dissolve the chemicals in food that will stimulate the gustatory receptor cell.
